name: Intro to Computer Science
description: An introduction to fundamental concepts in computer science, covering programming, algorithms, problem-solving, and the basics of data structures.

name: Data Structures
description: This course covers essential data structures such as linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs, as well as their implementations and applications in various algorithms.

name: Operating Systems
description: A comprehensive study of operating systems concepts, including process management, memory management, file systems, and concurrency in modern operating systems.

name: Fundamentals of Machine Learning
description: An introductory course to machine learning, covering supervised learning, unsupervised learning, neural networks, and key algorithms for classification and clustering.

name: Calculus I
description: An introduction to differential and integral calculus, focusing on limits, continuity, derivatives, integrals, and their applications in real-world problems.

name: Calculus II
description: A continuation of Calculus I, covering advanced integration techniques, sequences and series, parametric equations, and polar coordinates.

name: Intro to Physics
description: This course introduces the fundamentals of physics, covering classical mechanics, thermodynamics, electromagnetism, and optics.

name: Introduction to Philosophy
description: An overview of major philosophical ideas, thinkers, and debates from ancient to modern times, exploring topics such as ethics, metaphysics, and political philosophy.

name: Algorithms and Complexity
description: An in-depth look at algorithm design and analysis, including sorting, searching, dynamic programming, and an introduction to computational complexity theory.

name: Computer Networks
description: This course covers the principles and technologies of computer networks, focusing on the Internet protocol suite (TCP/IP), network architecture, and data transmission.

name: Database Systems
description: An introduction to database design, relational databases, SQL, normalization, and indexing, with a focus on building efficient database applications.

name: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
description: A foundational course in cybersecurity, covering topics such as encryption, network security, authentication, and risk management.

name: Introduction to Biology
description: An overview of biological concepts, including cell biology, genetics, evolution, and ecosystems, with a focus on understanding the diversity of life.

name: General Chemistry
description: A comprehensive introduction to chemistry, covering atomic structure, chemical bonding, thermodynamics, and the properties of gases, liquids, and solids.

name: Artificial Intelligence
description: This course provides an introduction to artificial intelligence, covering search algorithms, game theory, reasoning, and machine learning basics.

name: Advanced Machine Learning
description: An advanced course in machine learning, covering deep learning, reinforcement learning, and neural network architectures for various applications.

name: Blockchain and Distributed Ledger Technologies
description: An introduction to blockchain technology, covering the principles of distributed ledger systems, consensus mechanisms, smart contracts, and their applications.

name: Academic Writing
description: This course focuses on developing academic writing skills, including argumentative essays, research papers, and critical reading.

name: Advanced Software Engineering
description: An advanced course in software engineering, covering topics such as design patterns, software architecture, testing, and agile methodologies.

name: Capstone Project in Computer Science
description: A capstone project course where students work in teams to design and implement a large-scale software system, applying principles learned throughout the curriculum.
